Ingest_LDD.name: DSCOVR Mission Dictionary
Ingest_LDD.comment:
This dictionary contains classes and attributes specific to the DSCOVR (Deep Space Climate Observatory) mission.
IMPORTANT NOTE: This mission is a "rescue" mission, where PDS is saving the lunar data and making it available to the public before the mission gets canceled. As such, we did not have time or resources to throroughly research the metadata. It is basically copied straight from the documentation we have. For example, we do not know what the Quaternion is rotating, the sense of the rotation, or even if it's scalar-first or scalar-last. Hopefully these answers are buried in the documentation somewhere; if not, they must be divined by the user. Since the primary Earth archive is with ASDC, presumably they will have better information. It is not great that we have these holes, but better that than lose the data permanently.
The following fields in the HDF are not transferred to this LDD, because they were not applicable to the lunar case: Lunar group: centroid_mean_latitude centroid_mean_longitude geolocation_algorithm geospatial_(lat|lon)_(min|max) granule_version image_set_date (max|min)imum_(latitude|longitude) product_level bottom_latitude bottom_longitude centroid_center_height centroid_center_(latitude|longitude) east_longitude left_latitude left_longitude north_latitude south_latitude top_latitude top_longitude west_longitude Image group: centroid_center_(latitude|longitude) centroid_column_offset centroid_row_offset coordsys darkspace percent_bad_pixels all of the pixel_type values (they're in the documentation instead)
## CHANGE LOG ## 1.0.0.0 R. Deen - Initial version

DD_Attribute.name: a
DD_Attribute.definition: EPIC optical coefficient "a". See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: apparent_declination
DD_Attribute.definition: Declination corrected for nutation and precession. See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: apparent_right_ascension
DD_Attribute.definition: Right Ascension corrected for nutation and precession. See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: apparent_sidereal_time
DD_Attribute.definition: Apparent sidereal time. See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: b
DD_Attribute.definition: EPIC optical coefficient "b". See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: ccd_pixel_size
DD_Attribute.definition: CCD pixel size. See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: ccd_read_mode
DD_Attribute.definition: Indicates CCD read mode. Default is 51 (Mode 3). See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: corrected_rotation_x
DD_Attribute.definition: Corrected X rotation solution for transformation from ECR coordinates to spacecraft view. See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: corrected_rotation_y
DD_Attribute.definition: Corrected Y rotation solution for transformation from ECR coordinates to spacecraft view. See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: corrected_rotation_z
DD_Attribute.definition: Corrected Z rotation solution for transformation from ECR coordinates to spacecraft view. See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: declination
DD_Attribute.definition: Declination angle. See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: earth_north_direction
DD_Attribute.definition: Rotation angle required to rotate image so North is oriented to the top of the image. See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: ecliptic_obliquity
DD_Attribute.definition: Earth's obliquity in the ecliptic. See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: entity
DD_Attribute.definition: Indicates which entity the enclosing Ephemeris class applies to: Lunar, Solar, or the spacecraft itself (DSCOVR).

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Indicates that the enclosing Ephemeris class applies to the spacecraft itself.
Indicates that the enclosing Ephemeris class applies to the sun.
Indicates that the enclosing Ephemeris class applies to the moon.

DD_Attribute.name: equatorial_pixel_size
DD_Attribute.definition: Estimated Earth pixel size at equator (measured in pixels). See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: image_band
DD_Attribute.definition: Image band number. See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: k1
DD_Attribute.definition: EPIC optical coefficient "k1". See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: k2
DD_Attribute.definition: EPIC optical coefficient "k2". See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: k3
DD_Attribute.definition: EPIC optical coefficient "k3". See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: nutation_longitude
DD_Attribute.definition: Earth's nutation in longitutde. See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: nutation_obliquity
DD_Attribute.definition: Earth's nutation in obliquity. See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: p1
DD_Attribute.definition: EPIC optical coefficient "p1". See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: p2
DD_Attribute.definition: EPIC optical coefficient "p2". See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: p3
DD_Attribute.definition: EPIC optical coefficient "p3". See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: p4
DD_Attribute.definition: EPIC optical coefficient "p4". See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: polar_pixel_size
DD_Attribute.definition: Estimated Earth pixel size at poles (measured in pixels). See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: precession_ecliptic
DD_Attribute.definition: Precession in the ecliptic angle. See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: precession_equatorial
DD_Attribute.definition: Precession in the equatorial angle. See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: q0
DD_Attribute.definition: Quaternion component 0. See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: q1
DD_Attribute.definition: Quaternion component 1. See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: q2
DD_Attribute.definition: Quaternion component 2. See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: q3
DD_Attribute.definition: Quaternion component 3. See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: revision_number
DD_Attribute.definition: Revision number of data set.

DD_Attribute.name: right_ascension
DD_Attribute.definition: Geocentric right ascension angle. See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: startracker_rotation_x
DD_Attribute.definition: Original startracker X rotation solution for transformation from ECR coordinates to spacecraft view. See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: startracker_rotation_y
DD_Attribute.definition: Original startracker Y rotation solution for transformation from ECR coordinates to spacecraft view. See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: startracker_rotation_z
DD_Attribute.definition: Original startracker Z rotation solution for transformation from ECR coordinates to spacecraft view. See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: x_pixel_offset
DD_Attribute.definition: X offset of center of Earth from center of the image.

DD_Attribute.name: y_pixel_offset
DD_Attribute.definition: Y offset of center of Earth from center of the image.

DD_Attribute.name: x_position
DD_Attribute.definition: X position in J2000 coordiantes, in km.

DD_Attribute.name: y_position
DD_Attribute.definition: Y position in J2000 coordiantes, in km.

DD_Attribute.name: z_position
DD_Attribute.definition: Z position in J2000 coordiantes, in km.

DD_Attribute.name: x_velocity
DD_Attribute.definition: X velocity in km/s.

DD_Attribute.name: y_velocity
DD_Attribute.definition: Y velocity in km/s.

DD_Attribute.name: z_velocity
DD_Attribute.definition: Z velocity in km/s.

DD_Attribute.name: xc
DD_Attribute.definition: EPIC optical coefficient "xc". See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Attribute.name: yc
DD_Attribute.definition: EPIC optical coefficient "yc". See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Class.name: DSCOVR_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: This is a container class holding all the DSCOVR-specific attributes and classes.

DD_Class.name: EPIC_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: This is a container class holding all the camera-specific parameters for the EPIC (Earth Polychromatic Imaging Camera) on the DSCOVR mission. EPIC data of Earth is archived at the ASDC (Atmospheric Science Data Center). However, ASDC was unable to accept lunar images, so those are being archived in PDS in order to make them publicly available. Because of this history, the metadata descriptions in this class are largely direct transcriptions from the original HDF label, with minimal descriptions (in some cases insufficient for proper interpretation). Please see the DSCOVR-EPIC documentation either in the bundle or at ASDC for better explanations of this metadata.

DD_Class.name: Image_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: This class holds information about the EPIC camera that are not captured in the IMG dictionary.

DD_Class.name: Optical_Coefficient
DD_Class.definition: This class holds information about the optical coefficients of the EPIC camera. See the EPIC documentation for details.

DD_Class.name: Lunar_Geolocation
DD_Class.definition: This class holds information about the geolocation of EPIC images of the moon. See the EPIC documentation for more information on how to interpret these.

DD_Class.name: Centroid
DD_Class.definition: This class holds centroid information. See the EPIC documentation.

DD_Class.name: Ephemeris
DD_Class.definition: This class holds ephemeris information. See the EPIC documentation. Note that there can be multiple instances of this class, where the "entity" attribute defines what the ephemeris information applies to.

DD_Class.name: Quaternion
DD_Class.definition: Specifies attitude from star tracker as a rotation. See the EPIC documentation.
